intro: Manfreda malinaltenangensis, commonly known as the Malinaltenango manfreda, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapted to arid environments. The plant produces striking yellow flowers during the summer months, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
